The empanadas come with plantains chips. They are very tasty!
We also had a mango natural juice but didn't look real mango juice.

They have a great variety of unexpected combinations. They have dipping sauces and plantain chips instead of boring old chips. My favorite is the chicken pesto and the beef one. The place is small, but has a cool atmosphere. The staff is pleasant and friendly. The prices are not bad at all, and you would be supporting a local business....

Panas has very tasty empenadas. We particularly liked the chicken pesto and the popeye. We ordered a dozen (to serve 3 people) for a cost of about $25. Not a bad deal for dinner in DC!

I stopped by late one evening because of a recommendation from the hotel I was staying at. It was great, fast and flavorful! I'm not a huge dipping sauce person so I passed on those but the three different varieties of empanadas were moist and tasty without them. I'd definitely go back if I was in the area again.
